problem_text:
Conjecture:
(pq − 1)/(p − 1)
never divides
(qp − 1)/(q − 1)
if p, q are distinct primes.
The validity of this conjecture would simplify the proof of solvability of groups of odd order (W. Feit, J. G. Thompson, Pacific J. Math., 13, no. 3 (1963), 775–1029), rendering unnecessary the detailed use of generators and relations.
J. G. Thompson
